title: Agent: Skaggs named Reds' Miley as drug supplier

content: More than two months after the death of Miller Gardner, the 14-year-old son of former Yankees outfielder Brett Gardner, authorities in Costa Rica say the case remains under investigation.

content: Tottenham Hotspur have appointed Thomas Frank as the club's new head coach after prying the manager away from his previous post at Brentford.

title: Galatasaray sign Sané as free agent from Bayern
content: Galatasaray have completed a deal to sign Germany winger Leroy Sané from Bayern Munich on a three year contract, the Turkish Super Lig champions announced Thursday.

title: Poland manager quits after Lewandowski dispute
content: Poland manager Michal Probierz resigned  Thursday following a row over his decision to replace the country's record goal scorer Robert Lewandowski as captain.

title: Pep on City: Barça, Madrid would have sacked me
content: Pep Guardiola has said he would have been sacked by Barcelona or Real Madrid if he encountered similar struggles to those he faced at Manchester City this season.

title: U.S. great Michael Bradley named RBNY II coach
content: Former USMNT midfielder Michael Bradley has been hired as head coach of New York Red Bulls II, making it the first managerial role in his nascent coaching career.

content: The Club World Cup is upon us, and all 32 teams are bringing new kits to the tournament. Which ones earned the highest marks?

content: In our first 12-team mock draft of the offseason, running backs took priority in the early going in this 1/2 PPR setup.

title: Air India Crash May Be India's Most Expensive Aviation Insurance Claim
content: In the case of the Dreamliner crash, claims are expected under both the hull and liability sections as the Boeing turned into a ball of fire, killing hundreds of people.

title: Israel Attacks Iran News LIVE: Iran Vows Revenge, Says Israel's Attack Justify Push For Nuclear Technology
content: Israel Attacks Iran Live Updates: A new explosion was heard at a key uranium enrichment site in central Iran on Friday morning, hours after Israel launched unprecedented air strikes against the Islamic Republic's nuclear programme.

title: Trump Illegally Deployed National Guard, Must Return Control, Orders Judge
content: A federal judge issued a temporary restraining order Thursday directing President Donald Trump to return control of the National Guard to California.

title: Only Survivor Of Deadly Air India Crash Sparks Interest On Social Media
content: The notion that only one person survived the Air India plane crash that killed 241 people on board Thursday is sparking interest on social media about how that could happen and if such a thing has happened before.

title: Video Shows How Planes Emptied Iranian Skies During Israel's Attack
content: A Flightradar24 timelapse video captures the swift movement of civilian aircraft away from Iranian airspace following Israel's June 13 strikes.

title: Explained: What Is Flight Accident Insurance, Its Coverage And Cost
content: Plans for complete travel insurance provide a wide range of coverage aimed at protecting travellers from various risks.

title: '1206' Was Ex Chief Minister Vijay Rupani's 'Lucky' Number, Until It Wasn't
content: The number '1206' was never just a number for former Gujarat chief minister Vijay Rupani. It was a constant across the decades of his public and private life.

title: Viral Newspaper Ad Pulled Out After Air India Crash: "Crazy Coincidence"
content: A front-page newspaper advertisement featuring an Air India aircraft on Thursday is in the spotlight after Flight AI171, operated by the same airline, crashed hours later.

title: "Don't Know How I Got Saved": Air India Plane Crash Lone Survivor
content: Vishwash Kumar Ramesh, the 40-year-old British-Indian who miraculously survived the Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad yesterday, shared his ordeal with the media today.

title: Air India Mumbai-London Flight Returns After 3 Hours In Air: Flightradar24
content: An Air India flight, en route to London, returned to Mumbai after three hours in air, according to news agency PTI citing Flightradar24 data. The Mumbai-London flight remained in the air for three hours after departing from the airport at 5:39 am.

title: Tehran Warns Israel Of "Bitter, Painful" Fate After Attacks On Iran
content: Iran has vowed a "strong response" after Israel's deadly air strikes hit multiple areas, including military and nuclear facilities, across the Islamic Republic on Friday.

title: Raja's Killers Planned To Kill Someone Else, Pass Off Body As Sonam's: Cops
content: The killers of Indore-based businessman Raja Raghuvanshi had a plan to murder any woman and burn her body to pass it as that of his wife Sonam so that she would be able to be in hiding for a few more days till the truth is known, police said.

title: Delhi May Get Rain, Thunderstorm Today After Days Of Scorching Heat
content: Amid the scorching heat in Delhi after days of red alert, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast thunderstorm and rain later on Friday, which may bring some relief to the capital's residents.

title: Ahmedabad Plane Crash Live Updates: PM Visits Injured At Hospital, Meets Vijay Rupani's Family At Airport
content: Ahmedabad Air India Plane Crash Live Updates: A London-bound Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner crashed minutes after taking off from Ahmedabad airport on Thursday, killing 241 people on board. Only one person survived.

title: PM Modi Visits Ahmedabad Plane Crash Site, Meets Lone Survivor At Hospital
content: Ahmedabad Plane Crash: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Ahmedabad on Friday and visited the site of the Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner crash that killed 241 people a day earlier, one of the worst air disasters in recent times.

title: Monsoon Likely To Reach Delhi, Northwest By June 25: Weather Office
content: The southwest monsoon, which regained momentum this week, is expected to cover most parts of northwest India, including Delhi, by June 25, well ahead of the usual dates, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said.

title: Black Friday For Markets, Sensex Down Over 1.5% As Israel Attacks Iran
content: Indian stock markets witnessed a steep fall on Friday morning, marking what many are calling a "Black Friday" for investors. Both benchmark indices opened deep in the red, reacting sharply to rising geopolitical tensions in the Middle East.

title: "Remain Vigilant": India Issues Advisory For Citizens In Iran Amid Air Strikes
content: Indians in Iran on Friday were advised by the embassy here to remain vigilant, avoid all unnecessary movements and observe safety protocols following the launch of Israel's strikes on the country.

title: Hossein Salami: Iran Guards Chief And A Key Figure In Its Nuclear Program
content: Israel carried out a series of airstrikes in Iran's capital Tehran, killing Major General Hossein Salami, the head of the country's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC).

title: Who Was Kamal Kaur, Punjabi Influencer Found Dead In Parked Car In Punjab
content: Social media influencer Kamal Kaur was found dead in the back seat of a car parked at Adesh Medical University, Punjab, late Wednesday night.

content: The actor had visited the pub with a friend to celebrate her birthday when an argument broke out between her and the pub staff

title: ‘Deeply concerned’, says India after Israel strikes Iranian nuclear sites
content: ‘Existing channels of dialogue and diplomacy should be utilised to work towards a de-escalation of the situation,’ says MEA after Israel’s report attack on Iran nuclear sites.

title: Odisha clash: Internet suspension in Bhadrak extended till 6 p.m. on June 13
content: The district Collector said the situation was well under control and there is no untoward incident so far

title: Cross-border narco smuggling racket unearthed in Punjab, two arrested
content: An FIR under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act has been registered and investigation is underway to uncover the full extent of the network, police official said.

title: Andhra Pradesh Cabinet amends labour laws; approves 10-hour workday for labourers
content: The Cabinet has given its nod to the proposal recently; it has also decided to allow women to work in night shifts

title: Silent fall of single-screen theatres in Andhra
content: As technology barrels on, iconic single screens across Andhra Pradesh bleed money amid dwindling revenue. Nellore Sravani explains the fall of this once-prosperous business and the contentious profit-sharing model between exhibitors and distributors in the Telugu film industry that seems to be at the centre of it all

title: 16 Air India flights diverted or returned due to Israel’s attack on Iran
content: Sixteen Air India flights were diverted or retuned to their origin amid escalating tensions post Israel’s attack on Iran.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: ‘No government can replace him’, says teen victim’s father
content: Meanwhile, hundreds of grieving relatives remain on the hospital campus, waiting for confirmation on when they can claim their loved ones’ bodies.

title: The crop that is raising farm incomes — and eyebrows in Telangana
content: Once a fringe experiment, oil palm cultivation has rapidly taken root across Telangana, reshaping rural economy and farmer aspirations. Backed by subsidies, buyback guarantees and political push, the crop promises steady returns and sustainability. But beneath the optimism, there are concerns over volatile prices, labour shortages, water stress and ecological fallout. As the State races to expand acreage, experts and farmers have one question — can this boom withstand market shocks and environmental strain? P. Laxma Reddy and P. Sridhar report

title: Southwest monsoon: Four killed in rain-related incidents in Karnataka, orange alert declared for Kerala’s four districts
content: The India Meteorological Department has issued a red alert for Friday (June 13, 2025) for Karnataka’s Uttara Kannada, Udupi, Dakshina Kannada, Belagavi, Dharwad, Gadag, Chikkamagaluru, Kodagu and Shivamogga districts

title: PM Modi meets Air India plane crash survivor, injured victims at hospital in Ahmedabad
content: A formal investigation has been launched by the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) into the deadly crash

title: Kolar police ban two-wheelers, three-wheelers, tractors on Bengaluru–Chennai Expressway stretches after surge in accidents
content: The move comes after over 15 fatalities were reported in more than 10 accidents in the past three months

title: Once the heart of Home Rule movement, Chennai’s Gokhale Hall awaits restoration
content: Since its inception, the Gokhale Hall has played host to many eminent leaders of the freedom movement like Jawaharlal Nehru, S. Satyamurti, Morarji Desai, and K. Kamaraj, besides being the venue for Annie Besant’s ‘Wake Up India’ series of lectures

title: Claims, counter-claims over sharing Hemavati waters trigger a row
content: Hemavati Express Link Canal Project, which proposes transferring the river water from Gubbi taluk of Tumakuru district to nearby Magadi taluk in Bengaluru South district, has set off a controversy. The Hindu visits the project site to map the multiple layers of the row

title: Air India crash latest test for new Boeing leadership
content: A central factor in both MAX crashes was the Manoeuvring Characteristics Augmentation System (MCAS), a flight handling system that badly malfunctioned, pointing to design flaws.

title: From silver screen to Parliament: journey of Tamil actors to Rajya Sabha
content: Kamal Haasan is the eighth Tamil film actor to make the transition from the silver screen to the House of Elders

title: Building bridges to Kashmir
content: Srinagar is now closer to the rest of India with the newly inaugurated Udhampur-Srinagar-Baramulla link, of which the stretch from Jammu and Kashmir’s capital to Katra is ready. Peerzada Ashiq takes the train and speaks to those travelling on it to understand what the Vande Bharat Express means to people in the Valley. With 36 tunnels, the world’s highest railway arch bridge, and India’s first cable-stayed railway bridge, it is an engineering landmark that showcases the natural heritage of India’s northernmost region

title: Survivor of Air India crash jumped out of emergency exit, police say
content: Speaking from his hospital bed, the 40-year-old told Indian media that he was a British national and was travelling to Britain with his brother after visiting family in India

title: SIMS Hospital performs India’s first combined TAVR and aortic graft surgery in a redo heart procedure
content: This is the first time in India that TAVR and Frozen Elephant Trunk (FET) procedures were successfully combined in a single surgery for a patient with a previous Bentall operation, reducing the risks of multiple interventions and improving patient safety

title: Karnataka govt. plans annual art contest for students, general public in Bengaluru
content: A budget of ₹25 crore will be allocated for the event, says Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar announced at the inauguration of the renovated Venkatappa Art Gallery in Bengaluru

title: Team from Ministry of Jal Shakti reviews water projects in Chennai for National Water Awards
content: Officials from the Water Resources Department noted that Tamil Nadu has been shortlisted for the award

title: 76.14% students pass SSC Advanced Supplementary examinations in A.P.
content: Girls secure pass percentage of 80.10%, which is 6.55% higher than boys; Prakasam district tops the State with 98.24% success rate, West Godavari district records the lowest of 50.24%; time till June 19 to apply for recounting, reverification

title: How can police expect UIDAI to compare fingerprints of dead with Aadhaar biometrics of over 100 crore people? asks HC judge
content: Justice P. Velmurugan dismisses a petition filed by Tindivanam DSP seeking a direction to UIDAI to provide biometric information related to an unclaimed body

title: Op Rising Lion: Iran fires 100 drones at Israel in retaliatory attack - 10 things to know
content: Amidst escalating tensions over Iran's nuclear program, Israel launched preemptive strikes targeting Iranian nuclear and military sites, resulting in casualties, including key military and nuclear personnel. Prime Minister Netanyahu declared the operation aimed at eliminating the Iranian threat, prompting airspace restrictions and warnings of potential retaliation.

title: Operation 'Rising Lion': What nuclear facility did Israel strike in Iran? Why this site was chosen
content: Israel has launched a targeted military operation against Iran, striking nuclear and military sites, including Tehran's ballistic missile program, citing a threat to its survival. Air-raid sirens sounded in Israel as a precaution. The attack follows rising tensions over Iran's nuclear program and a recent IAEA censure, prompting international concern and a surge in oil prices.

title: 'Had it been 2pm, more would’ve died': Inside doctors' quarters when plane crashed
content: A devastating Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad claimed the lives of resident doctors and others near BJ Medical College. The aircraft struck residential buildings and the doctors' mess, resulting in immediate fire and chaos.

title: Microsoft's top executive to software engineers: If you're going to work with AI-generated code, you need…
content: Microsoft executives emphasize the enduring importance of coding skills in the age of AI. Aparna Chennapragada argues that logical and critical thinking, inherent in coding, are crucial for collaborating with AI systems. Satya Nadella highlights the need for computational thinking and structured instruction, envisioning a future where everyone is a software architect.

title: AI 171 tragedy: How seat 11A proved to be lucky for Air India crash survivor
content: Viswashkumar Ramesh, sole survivor of the AI 171 Dreamliner crash near Ahmedabad, recalls a violent jolt and the pilot's distress call before the aircraft disintegrated. The UK-based businessman, miraculously rescued from seat 11A, now lies in hospital, haunted by the loss of his brother and the devastating tragedy.

title: Israel-Iran conflict escalates: Several Air India flights diverted - full list
content: Air India changed several international flights because of the emergency in Iran. Flights to and from the US, the UK, and Canada were affected. Some flights were rerouted, and others returned to where they started. The airline is helping passengers with accommodations and refunds. Passengers should check their flight status for updates.

title: ISIS plot: Pakistani extradited over NYC terror plan; Encrypted message warned of largest attack on US
content: Muhammad Shahzeb Khan, a Pakistani citizen residing in Canada, has been extradited to the U.S. for allegedly plotting an ISIS-inspired mass shooting at a New York City Jewish community center. The attack, planned for the anniversary of the October 7th Hamas attacks, was foiled through encrypted messaging app monitoring.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the outlook after Israel strikes Iran - should you buy or sell?
content: Gold price prediction today: MCX Gold August 2025 contract witnessed a significant surge, opening at ₹100,300 due to geopolitical tensions and dollar weakness. Analysts suggest a buy-on-dips strategy near ₹99,000, citing strong support levels and a favorable risk-reward ratio.

title: Operation Rising Lion: Did Trump know in advance of Israel's strikes on Iran? What he said
content: Donald Trump stated he had prior knowledge of Israel's strikes on Iran, emphasizing Iran must not acquire nuclear weapons. Israel launched Operation Rising Lion, targeting Iranian nuclear and military facilities, while the US clarified its non-involvement, prioritizing the protection of American forces. Despite the attack, Trump advocated for a diplomatic resolution to the Iran nuclear issue.

title: Bengaluru accident: 4 dead, 16 injured in APSRTC bus-truck crash near Hoskote
content: A tragic collision between an APSRTC bus and a truck near Hoskote, Bengaluru Rural, resulted in the death of four individuals, including two children, and injuries to at least 16 passengers. Preliminary investigations suggest the accident was caused by the bus driver's rash driving, suspected drowsiness, and overspeeding while attempting to overtake the truck.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: There’s a new programming language. It is called…
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang recently highlighted AI's transformative potential, stating it democratizes programming by enabling users to instruct computers using natural language. He likened programming AI to guiding a person, emphasizing the ease with which AI can now perform complex tasks like writing poems.

title: Stock Market Crash: Nifty goes below 24,550; Sensex tanks over 1,100 - top reasons
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in trade on Friday on global cues. While Nifty50 crashed below 24,550, BSE Sensex tumbled over 1,100 points.

title: 'Explosions across Tehran': Visuals capture Israel's strike on Iran
content: Tensions escalate as Israel launches attacks on Iran's nuclear and military sites, including the Natanz facility, prompting international concern. Prime Minister Netanyahu asserts the strikes will persist until the threat is eliminated. The US acknowledges Israel's unilateral action, prioritizing the protection of American forces. Explosions rocked Tehran, with both nations closing their airspace amid heightened alert and emergency declarations.

title: San Francisco Unicorns register largest win in MLC history; beat defending champions Washington Freedom by 123 runs
content: Finn Allen's explosive 151, featuring a record-breaking 19 sixes, propelled the San Francisco Unicorns to a massive 123-run victory over Washington Freedom in the MLC opener. The Unicorns set a league record with 269/5, while Freedom's chase faltered after a promising start, leading to a dominant win for the home side. Allen's performance earned him Player of the Match honors.

title: Israel strikes Iran: India issues advisory for nationals
content: Following Israel's strikes on Iranian nuclear and military sites, the Indian Embassy in Iran has issued an advisory urging Indian nationals and persons of Indian origin to exercise caution. The embassy emphasised vigilance, avoidance of unnecessary travel, and adherence to safety protocols advised by local authorities amidst reported explosions in Tehran and Natanz.

title: Operation Rising Lion: Who was Hossein Salami? Iran's IRGC chief killed in Israeli strikes
content: Hossein Salami, the Commander-in-Chief of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC), has reportedly been killed in a targeted military operation by Israel. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced the operation, named "Rising Lion," aimed at dismantling Iran's nuclear and ballistic missile programs, citing the existential threat to Israel. Netanyahu claimed Iran possesses enough enriched uranium for nine atomic bombs.

title: Sunjay Kapur passes away at 53: Kareena, and Malaika visit Karisma's house
content: Indian industrialist Sunjay Kapur, ex-husband of Karisma Kapoor, tragically died at 53 in the UK from a heart attack while playing polo. A bee entering his mouth reportedly triggered the event. Hours before, he tweeted condolences for the Air India crash. Kareena Kapoor, Saif Ali Khan, and Malaika Arora were seen visiting Karisma to offer support.

title: Why white swan named ‘Joy’ flying to space with Shubhanshu Shukla?
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla will become the first Indian astronaut to reach the ISS since 1984, aboard the Axiom-4 mission. Accompanying him is ‘Joy’, a white plush swan serving as the crew’s zero-gravity indicator and a symbolic tribute to Indian culture. Representing the vahana of Goddess Saraswati, Joy blends spirituality with space tradition. The mission highlights India’s growing role in global space exploration, backed by ISRO and SpaceX, and underscores the soft power of cultural symbolism in scientific frontiers.

title: Boxing event shooting: Ex-NFL star Brown faces attempted murder charge
content: Former NFL star Antonio Brown faces serious legal trouble. A warrant has been issued for his arrest in Miami-Dade County, accusing him of attempted murder with a firearm. The charges stem from an altercation outside a celebrity boxing event in May. Surveillance footage allegedly shows Brown firing shots at a man, who sustained injuries.

title: India vs India A intra-squad match Live streaming: When and where to watch
content: India prepares for the England Test series with a strategic intra-squad warm-up game, prioritizing privacy and acclimatization. The closed-door practice match, featuring 360 overs of simulation, aims to fine-tune player fitness, resolve selection dilemmas, and allow Shubman Gill to lead the team in a low-pressure environment.

title: Iraq closes airspace: All flights halted after Israel strikes Iran
content: Following Israeli military action against Iran, Iraq has shut down its airspace and halted all air traffic. Prime Minister Netanyahu confirmed the strikes, dubbed "Rising Lion," targeting Iranian nuclear and military facilities, while Israel's defense minister called them preemptive due to concerns over Iran's uranium enrichment. The US has denied any involvement in the operation.

title: Operation Rising Lion: Iran's key uranium enrichment facility hit 'several times'
content: Israel has launched Operation Rising Lion, a military operation targeting Iranian military and nuclear sites, including the Natanz enrichment facility. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu stated the operation aims to neutralize Iran's nuclear program, missile capabilities, and military infrastructure. Flights have been suspended at Tehran's international airport as a precaution, marking a major escalation between the two nations.

title: Air India crash: Gujarat ex-CM Vijay Rupani believed 1206 his lucky no.
content: Former Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani, known for his lucky number 1206, tragically died in a plane crash on June 12, a date mirroring his cherished number. He was en route to London to visit his family, a trip rescheduled due to by-election duties.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests a positive outlook for the Indian stock market on June 13, 2025, highlighting Sterling and Wilson Renewable Energy, and Prince Pipes and Fittings as top stock picks. Nifty is expected to find support around 24,600-24,700, potentially reaching 25,300-25,500, while Bank Nifty aims for 57,000-57,700, supported by positive market internals.

title: 'Everybody hates Russia but loves Germany and Japan': Trump calls it a 'strange world'
content: Donald Trump spoke about World War II. He mentioned conversations with Emmanuel Macron and Vladimir Putin. Macron spoke of France's victory. Putin highlighted Soviet sacrifices. Trump expressed surprise at America's lack of commemoration. He noted the US role in the Allied victory. He also mentioned Germany and Japan's current status.

title: AI crash: Boeing, a whistleblower, & his 'gap' warning - 'That’s not how ... '
content: Air India Flight AI171, a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, crashed shortly after takeoff from Ahmedabad, killing all 242 onboard. The tragedy has brought renewed attention to whistleblower Sam Salehpour's 2024 warnings about structural flaws in the 787 Dreamliner. Salehpour alleged shortcuts in manufacturing could lead to catastrophic failure. Boeing has refuted these claims, stating the aircraft is safe.

title: MLC 2025: Unicorns post 269/5 in record fest at Oakland Coliseum; Finn Allen slams 151
content: Finn Allen's explosive innings of 150 runs off 49 balls propelled the San Francisco Unicorns to a record-breaking total in the Major League Cricket season opener. Allen smashed 19 sixes, setting new benchmarks for the fastest 150 in T20 cricket and most sixes in a men's T20 innings.

title: 'Anyone who will try to challenge us ... ': Israel strikes Iran; targets nuclear facilities
content: Israel launched a military operation against Iran late Thursday, with explosions reported in Tehran. Israel's defense minister confirmed the 'preemptive strikes,' citing Iran's continued uranium enrichment. The US denies involvement, emphasizing the action was Israel's decision and warning Iran against targeting US interests.

title: Israel strikes Iran: ‘Hit at heart of ballistic missile programme,’ says Netanyahu; watch
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced a 'targeted military operation' against Iran, dubbed "Rising Lion," aimed at dismantling Iran's nuclear and ballistic missile programs. The strikes, which targeted key facilities like Natanz and nuclear scientists, come amid escalating tensions over Iran's nuclear ambitions and stalled negotiations with the United States.

title: Trump’s immigration shift? What US President said on farm labors; watch video
content: US President Donald Trump hinted at a potential policy shift on immigration, suggesting some undocumented immigrants could stay to prevent labor shortages in agriculture and hospitality. An executive order is being considered to protect farm workers, many of whom lack legal status but have worked for years.

title: Watch: Senator forcibly removed, handcuffed at Noem’s news conference
content: Democratic Senator Alex Padilla was forcibly removed and handcuffed during Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem's Los Angeles press conference, sparking national outrage. Padilla interrupted Noem to question immigration raids, leading to a confrontation where he was pushed to the ground. Democrats condemned the incident as an abuse of power, while Republicans defended Noem, accusing Padilla of inappropriate behavior.

title: WTC Final: 'Two Balls Can Wrap It Up'; Lungi Ngidi on SA's fightback vs Aus
content: South African seamer Lungi Ngidi expressed optimism after Day 2 of the World Test Championship Final against Australia, despite a first-innings batting collapse. Ngidi highlighted the coach's encouragement to play with conviction and aim to turn the game around. He found his rhythm with Bavuma's guidance and drew energy from the crowd.

title: 'Dead bodies scattered all over': Eyewitness on Ahmedabad plane crash
content: Tragedy struck Ahmedabad as an Air India flight, en route to London, crashed shortly after takeoff from Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport. The aircraft plummeted into a hostel in the Meghani area, resulting in a massive fire and widespread debris. Eyewitnesses reported a scene of devastation with smoke, scattered debris, and casualties.

title: ‘Housefull 5’ BO collection: Akshay Kumar’s film touches Rs 127 crore
content: Tarun Mansukhani's 'Housefull 5,' starring Akshay Kumar, Riteish Deshmukh, and Abhishek Bachchan, premiered on June 6, 2025, with two versions. Despite mixed reviews, the film opened strongly, earning Rs 127 crore in its first week. However, collections dipped from Day 4, with Day 7 estimated at Rs 6.75 crore, showing a weekday decline in occupancy.

title: Finn Allen smashes fastest century in league history vs Washington Freedom
content: Finn Allen's explosive century off just 34 balls propelled San Francisco Unicorns to a dominant victory against Washington Freedom in the MLC 2025 opener. Allen's record-breaking innings surpassed Nicholas Pooran's previous mark, setting a blistering pace for the tournament. San Francisco capitalized on the fresh wicket after being put in to bat, leaving Washington's bowlers struggling to contain the onslaught.

title: After winning five straight finals, Shreyas Iyer loses back-to-back title clashes
content: Shreyas Iyer faced another setback as his SoBo Mumbai Falcons lost to Mumbai South Central Maratha Royals in the T20 Mumbai League final, mirroring his IPL final defeat with Punjab Kings. Despite Iyer's emotional encouragement and Rohit Sharma's presence, the loss marked a second consecutive final disappointment for the Indian batter, leaving him to reflect on missed opportunities.

title: WTC Final: Kagiso Rabada enters South Africa’s top five Test wicket-takers
content: Kagiso Rabada etched his name in South African cricket history, surpassing Jacques Kallis to become the fifth-highest wicket-taker across all formats during the World Test Championship Final against Australia at Lord's. Rabada's impressive performance, including a five-wicket haul, propelled him past Kallis's 572 wickets.

title: Bombay High Court stays SC, ST, OBC reservations in minority institutions for class 11 admissions
content: The court passed the order on a bunch of petitions moved by Maharashtra Association of Minority Educational Institutions, along with prominent colleges such as, Jai Hind, KC College, St. Xavier’s, Walchand College of Arts and Science and Hirachand Nemchand College of Commerce

title: Akram Pasha takes charge as KSRTC Managing Director
content: Pasha’s appointment comes at a time when KSRTC and other transport corporations in Karnataka are facing a significant financial crunch

title: NIA searches 15 locations in Punjab, Haryana in Babbar Khalsa-linked grenade attack case
content: Accused Harpreet Singh claimed responsibility for multiple attacks; U.S.-based operatives, narco-terror links under scanner

title: Modi-Carney meeting on G7 sidelines to focus on bilateral reset: MEA
content: Engagement to address mutual concerns; law enforcement dialogue on Khalistan issue to continue, says Jaiswal

title: Maharashtra Minister bats for MNS-BJP alliance after Raj Thackeray meets Fadnavis
content: The meeting comes amid ongoing buzz about a possible reconciliation between the estranged Thackeray cousins — Raj and Uddhav Thackeray, who heads the Shiv Sena (UBT)

title: Anti-ragging regulations: UGC serves show cause notices to seven varsities in Karnataka
content: Indian Institute of Management Bangalore (IIMB) and Bengaluru City University are among those served the notices

title: What made Boeing 787s popular – and later a cause for concern
content: Before the crash, Trump’s nominee to head the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration vowed to hold Boeing accountable over the 737 Max

title: West Bengal School Service Commission holds talks with ‘sacked’ teachers
content: Hundreds of ‘untainted’ teachers, who lost their jobs after an April 3 Supreme Court order invalidating nearly 26,000 teaching and non-teaching jobs, gathered at Karunamoyee in Bidhannagar and marched to the WBSSC office

title: More feeder buses likely on Thripunithura metro station-Infopark stretch
content: An air-conditioned CNG feeder bus has begun service on the route; eight daily services planned to improve last-mile connectivity to Infopark

title: Experts, govt. officials call for urgent need for ecosystem restoration in West Bengal
content: Senior officials call for partnerships with academia and corporates to combat climate change and biodiversity loss

title: Ahead of Bihar polls, INDIA bloc says it will expose ‘failures’ of Nitish Kumar’s govt.
content: Bihar Janata Dal (United) president Umesh Singh Kushwaha hits back saying that the “so-called unity” of the alliance is based on the weak foundations of ‘selfishness and opportunism’

title: Revised DPR for elevated highway on Edappally-Aroor bypass not yet ready
content: Decision pending on alignment near flyovers and metro viaduct stalls finalisation of revised project report; NHAI yet to decide between planned trumpet flyover and expansive clover-leaf design at Nettoor

title: Ahmedabad air crash: Overloading, ‘bird hit’ among probable causes, say experts
content: “The odds of both engines failing simultaneously during take-off are quite small or about one in a billion,” says Abhay Pashilkar, Director, CSIR-National Aerospace Laboratories

title: Plane crash: Railways to run two special trains from Ahmedabad to Mumbai and Delhi
content: Bookings for trains 09497, 09494 and 09493 are open on Tatkal basis at passenger reservation system counters and IRCTC website. The train calendars can be checked on www.enquiry.indianrail.gov.in.

title: Naidu slams Jagan, says harm to law and order, public safety will not be tolerated
content: CM accuses YSRCP president of stirring up trouble in Podili to divert attention from their comments on Amaravati

title: India condemns vandalism at Tagore’s ancestral home in Bangladesh
content: MEA terms June 8 incident ‘despicable’, urges Dhaka to act against extremists targeting cultural symbols

title: Flight AI 171 crash akin to crash of Emperor Ashoka, 47 years ago
content: Air India Flight AI 855, named Emperor Ashoka, a Boeing 747-237 B crashed into Arabian Sea soon after take-off from Mumbai airport on January 1, 1978

title: Eleven from Rajasthan among victims of Air India crash after take-off from Ahmedabad
content: Five-member physician’s family from Banswara, marble trader’s children from Udaipur among those on board

title: Two cabin crew members from Manipur onboard crashed Air India flight in Gujarat
content: Families of Kongbrailatpam Nganthoi Sharma and Lamnunthem Singson await updates as uncertainty prevails

title: Condolences pour in for victims of Ahmedabad air crash
content: Country’s leadership stands united in grief; President Droupadi Murmu called it a “heart-rending” disaster

title: Education system in Telangana in bad shape under Cong: BRS
content: Party leader R.S. Praveen Kumar alleges that the State Govt. intentionally neglecting residential schools in the name of Young India

title: Heavy rain batters twin cities, inundates arterial roads and low-lying areas
content: II PU exam goes on as per schedule even as holiday has been declared for anganwadis, schools and colleges on Friday also

title: Beleaguered KMRL forced to explore ways to restore discount cards for students
content: The metro agency withdrew ‘Vidya’ passes on April 1 without notice; MP says the move hit student budgets and worsened delays during peak hours amid congestion from extension works

title: Operation Sindoor exposed China, Türkiye as threat to country’s sovereignty and trade: Swadeshi Jagran Manch
content: Launching a pan-India drive to create awareness about use of ‘swadeshi’  goods, the RSS-backed outfit says it will ‘awaken people’ about domination of e-commerce websites in the Indian market causing heavy losses to local traders

title: Grassroots initiative in Pune district records over 350 wildlife sightings in six months
content: Farmers and herders in Purandar taluk aid conservation efforts by monitoring non-protected grasslands under ‘Wildlife Watchers’ programme

title: Gen Z slang takes over: are you in or out ?
content: Expressions such as pookie, rizz, aura, bussin, and diva dominate the daily conversations of Generation Z,  making it impossible for anyone outside their bubble to keep up with or escape their “unserious” vocabulary

title: UDF tries out Selfie to bond with the grassroots in Nilambur
content: Artistes under Congress’s Samskara Sahiti join UDF campaign, come out with a street play ‘exposing government failures and ministerial infighting’. Satire is used deftly to deliver ‘unpleasant messages.’

title: Boeing 787 Dreamliner and its history of failures | Explained
content: Over 200 people have died as an Air India Boeing 787 aircraft crashed minutes after departing from Ahmedabad airport

title: CAG to involve experts from empanelled CA firms for auditing of autonomous bodies
content: An official says this decision has been taken in view of the limited technical resources available with the institution vis-a-vis the vast audit landscape in this area

title: CSBC to conduct six-phase written examination for 19,838 constable posts in Bihar from July 16
content: Over 16.7 lakh valid applications received; examination to be held across all 38 districts amid stringent security and surveillance

title: Karnataka to seek increase in devolution funds under 16th Finance Commission
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, who also holds the Finance portfolio, and his economic adviser and MLA Basavaraja Rayareddy, and senior officials would participate in the meeting on Friday

title: Naidu launches ‘Talliki Vandanam’, ₹10,091 crore to be disbursed for 67 lakh students
content: CM hands over related G.O.s to HRD Minister Lokesh, marking one year of NDA government; says all Super Six promises being implemented

title: Authorities decide to commence land acquisition for Sabari rail
content: A high-level meeting convened by the State government directs the District Collectors of Ernakulam, Idukki and Kottayam to proceed with acquiring required land

title: Grading the Rangers, Ducks on the Chris Kreider trade
content: the Rangers sent Chris Kreider and a 2025 fourth-round pick to the Ducks . the new york Rangers could find a replacement elsewhere . there were many reasons that influenced the decision to move on .

title: Pride of the Yankees: Three days with Aaron Judge on the road to immortality
content: Aaron Judge has a four-month-old daughter, nora, his first child . "naps are tough," he said with a laugh . the only safe space in a baseball season is right now .

title: Aaron Rodgers, back in camp: How the 41-year-old left an impression on his Pittsburgh teammates
content: new: "you broke my heart in the Super Bowl, but I forgive you," he says . new: the 40-year-old has been greeting players at mandatory minicamp for the past five years . the steelers quarterback is a polarizine . he's a longtime fan of the Steelers .
